required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Compare the Efficacy and Safety of Micafungin Versus Conventional Amphotericin B for the Treatment of Neonatal Candidiasis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Randomized, Double-Blind, Multi-Center Study to Compare the Efficacy and Safety of Micafungin Versus Amphotericin B Deoxycholate for the Treatment of Neonatal Candidiasis

brief_summary.textblock: The study will evaluate how effective and how safe the drug micafungin is when compared to the drug amphotericin B deoxycholate in treating neonates and young infants with certain fungal infections.

detailed_description.textblock: Neonates and young infants will be stratified by estimated gestational age and by world region

clinical_study.why_stopped: It was decided to discontinue the study due to insufficient recruitment.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: One week after the last dose of study drug (maximum of 49 days)
primary_outcome.description: Fungal-free survival was assessed by an independent data review panel (DRP). Fungal-free survival is defined as the percentage of participants alive at one week following the last dose of study drug with a mycological response of eradication and no requirement for alternative systemic antifungal therapy for continued treatment. Eradication was defined as culture or histologically documented absence of the infecting Candida species from all positive normally sterile sites during therapy, documented by 2 negative samples, drawn at least 24 hours apart, or for Candida meningitis and/or candiduria, 1 negative culture.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Mycological Clearance of Invasive Candidiasis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose up to 30 days after the last dose of study drug (maximum of 72 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Time to mycological clearance of invasive candidiasis is defined as the time from first dose to the day of mycological eradication for baseline invasive candidiasis infection. Eradication was defined as a culture or histologically documented absence of the infecting Candida species from all positive normally sterile sites during therapy, documented by 2 negative samples, drawn at least 24 hours apart, or for for Candida meningitis and/or candiduria, 1 negative culture. Infants without eradication during the treatment period and who survived were censored at one day after the end of treatment. Infants without eradication who died before completing the treatment period or were lost to follow-up during the treatment were censored at their death or last contact day.

secondary_outcome.measure: Fungal-free Survival at End of Study Drug Therapy in Infants With End-organ Dissemination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The end of study drug therapy; maximum of 42 days
secondary_outcome.description: Fungal-free survival was assessed by an independent data review panel (DRP). Fungal-free survival is defined as the percentage of participants alive at the end of study drug therapy with a mycological response of eradication based upon the DRP assessment and no requirement for alternative systemic antifungal therapy for continued treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Fungal-free Survival One Week After Last Dose of Study Drug in Infants With End-organ Dissemination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One week after the last dose of study drug (maximum of 49 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Fungal-free survival was assessed by an independent data review panel (DRP). Fungal-free survival is defined as the percentage of participants alive one week after last dose of study drug with a mycological response of eradication based upon the DRP assessment and no requirement for alternative systemic antifungal therapy for continued treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Emergent Fungal Infections
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after the last dose of study drug (maximum of 72 days)
secondary_outcome.description: An emergent fungal infection is defined as An invasive fungal infection which is detected at any time during the study that is a non-Candida organism, or An invasive fungal infection which is detected during the treatment or post-treatment period with a Candida species identified other than those detected at Baseline. If this occurred within 96 hours of the first dose of study drug, the infection was considered part of the final diagnosis of enrolling infection and not an emergent infection.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Recurrent Fungal Infections
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after the last dose of study drug (maximum of 72 days)
secondary_outcome.description: A recurrent infection is defined as a systemic fungal infection in an infant with eradication at the end of study drug therapy, who developed positive blood cultures or a mycologically confirmed deep-seated Candida infection, with the same species as the enrolling infection.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose up to 30 days after the last dose of study drug (maximum of 72 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Time to a positive clinical response is defined as the time from the first dose to the day during the treatment period that a positive clinical response (defined as a complete response or partial response) is observed for the first time, assessed by the Investigator. Complete Response is defined as the resolution of all attributable signs related to fungal infection, if present at baseline and Partial Response is defined as improvement in attributable signs related to the fungal infection, if present at baseline. Infants without positive responses and who survived were censored at one day post the end of treatment. Infants without positive responses who died before completing the treatment period, or were lost to follow-up during the treatment were censored at their death or last contact day.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Response at the End of Study Drug Therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of study drug therapy; maximum of 42 days
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical response assessments were based on the following definitions and assessed by the DRP: Complete Response: Resolution of all attributable signs related to fungal infection, if present at baseline. Partial Response: Improvement in attributable signs related to the fungal infection, if present at baseline. Stabilization: Minor improvement or no change in attributable signs related to the fungal infection, if present at baseline, and infant continued on therapy without deterioration. Progression: Deterioration in attributable signs related to the fungal infection, if present at baseline; or if death occurred presumably related to a fungal infection.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Response One Week After Last Dose of Study Drug
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and one week after the last dose of study drug (maximum of 49 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical response assessments were based on the following definitions and assessed by the DRP: Complete Response: Resolution of all attributable signs related to fungal infection, if present at baseline. Partial Response: Improvement in attributable signs related to the fungal infection, if present at baseline. Stabilization: Minor improvement or no change in attributable signs related to the fungal infection, if present at baseline, and infant continued on therapy without deterioration. Progression: Deterioration in attributable signs related to the fungal infection, if present at baseline; or if death occurred presumably related to a fungal infection.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mycological Response at End of Study Drug Therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of study drug therapy; maximum of 42 days
secondary_outcome.description: Mycological response assessments were based on the following definitions and assessed by the DRP: Eradication: Culture or histologically documented absence of the infecting Candida species from all positive normally sterile sites during therapy, documented by 2 negative samples, drawn at least 24 h apart; for Candida meningitis and/or candiduria, 1 negative culture. Persistence: Continued isolation or histological documentation from a normally sterile site.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mycological Response One Week After Last Dose of Study Drug
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One week after the last dose of study drug (maximum of 49 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Mycological response assessments were based on the following definitions and assessed by the DRP: Eradication: Culture or histologically documented absence of the infecting Candida species from all positive normally sterile sites during therapy, documented by 2 negative samples, drawn at least 24 h apart; for Candida meningitis and/or candiduria, 1 negative culture. Persistence: Continued isolation or histological documentation from a normally sterile site.

secondary_outcome.measure: Follow-up Status for Infants With End-organ Assessments
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 30 days after the last dose of study drug (maximum of 72 days)
secondary_outcome.description: End-organ dissemination was assessed through abdominal ultrasound and/or computed tomography (CT), echocardiogram, head imaging and retinal exam. Each specific finding, documented by 1 of these techniques, was evaluated as follows: Improvement: Improvement in size, number or density of identified lesions. Complete response was not expected but may have been documented. Stabilization: Minor improvement or no change in size, number or density of identified lesions. Worsening: Increase in size or number of identified lesions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 15 minutes post intravenous infusion (IV), 4-8 hours post IV and 15-24 hours post IV

arm_group.description: Infants received micafungin at a dose of 10 mg/kg per day by intravenous infusion for a minimum of 21 days to a maximum of 28 days for infants without end-organ dissemination or for a maximum of 42 days for infants with end-organ dissemination.

Infants received amphotericin B deoxycholate (CAB) at a dose of 1.0 mg/kg per day by intravenous infusion for a minimum of 21 days to a maximum of 28 days for infants without end-organ dissemination or for a maximum of 42 days for infants with end-organ dissemination.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Infant greater than 48 hours of life after birth up to day of life 120 at the time of culture acquisition
- Diagnosis of proven invasive candidiasis within 4 days prior to study start
- Subject's parent or legal guardian agrees not to allow subject to participate in another study with another investigational drug while on treatment.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Infant with any history of a hypersensitivity or severe vasomotor reaction to any echinocandin or systemic amphotericin B product
- Infant who has received more than 48 hours of systemic antifungal therapy prior to the first dose of study drug
- Infant who has a breakthrough systemic fungal infection while receiving amphotericin B product or an echinocandin as prophylaxis
- Infant who has failed prior systemic antifungal therapy for this episode of invasive candidiasis
- Infant who is co-infected with a non-Candida fungal organism
- Infant whose positive yeast cultures are solely from an indwelling bladder catheter (unless obtained at the time the indwelling catheter was placed) or sputum.
- Infant previously enrolled in this study

facility.name: Irmandade da Santa Casa de Misericórdia de Belo Horizonte
Hospital de Base da Faculdade de Medicina
Spec Hospital for Active Treatment of Children Diseases

link.description: Link to results on Astellas Clinical Study Results Web site

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Infants greater than 48 hours of life through day of life (DOL) 120 with a diagnosis of invasive candidiasis were eligible for this study.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: In total, 31 infants were screened and 30 were randomized in a 2:1 ratio to receive micafungin or amphotericin B deoxycholate. Randomization was stratified by estimated gestational age (< 27 weeks, ≥ 27 weeks) and by region (North America/Europe, Latin America / Mexico, other region).

group.title: Micafungin
group.description: Infants received micafungin at a dose of 10 mg/kg per day by intravenous infusion for a minimum of 21 days to a maximum of 28 days for infants without end-organ dissemination or for a maximum of 42 days for infants with end-organ dissemination.

group.title: Amphotericin B
group.description: Infants received amphotericin B deoxycholate (CAB) at a dose of 1.0 mg/kg per day by intravenous infusion for a minimum of 21 days to a maximum of 28 days for infants without end-organ dissemination or for a maximum of 42 days for infants with end-organ dissemination.

group.title: Micafungin
group.description: Infants received micafungin at a dose of 10 mg/kg per day by intravenous infusion for a minimum of 21 days to a maximum of 28 days for infants without end-organ dissemination or for a maximum of 42 days for infants with end-organ dissemination.

group.title: Amphotericin B
group.description: Infants received amphotericin B deoxycholate (CAB) at a dose of 1.0 mg/kg per day by intravenous infusion for a minimum of 21 days to a maximum of 28 days for infants without end-organ dissemination or for a maximum of 42 days for infants with end-organ dissemination.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Fungal Infection Type
measure.description: Candidemia: diagnosed if Candida isolated from blood only; Invasive candidiasis: diagnosed if Candida isolated from blood in addition to other body fluids such as cerebrospinal fluid (CSF), peritoneal fluid, or urine.

measure.title: Presence of End-Organ Dissemination (EOD)
measure.description: End-organ dissemination was assessed using echocardiogram, abdominal ultrasound, including evaluation of the liver, spleen, and kidneys, head ultrasound, computed tomography (CT) or magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), and retinal exam (if clinically feasible). End-organ dissemination was assessed by the data review panel (DRP). Missing for the DRP assessment means that no evidence for EOD was documented.

outcome.title: Fungal-free Survival
outcome.description: Fungal-free survival was assessed by an independent data review panel (DRP). Fungal-free survival is defined as the percentage of participants alive at one week following the last dose of study drug with a mycological response of eradication and no requirement for alternative systemic antifungal therapy for continued treatment. Eradication was defined as culture or histologically documented absence of the infecting Candida species from all positive normally sterile sites during therapy, documented by 2 negative samples, drawn at least 24 hours apart, or for Candida meningitis and/or candiduria, 1 negative culture.
outcome.time_frame: One week after the last dose of study drug (maximum of 49 days)
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (all randomized infants who were administered any amount of study drug)

group.title: Micafungin
group.description: Infants received micafungin at a dose of 10 mg/kg per day by intravenous infusion for a minimum of 21 days to a maximum of 28 days for infants without end-organ dissemination or for a maximum of 42 days for infants with end-organ dissemination.

group.description: Infants received amphotericin B deoxycholate (CAB) at a dose of 1.0 mg/kg per day by intravenous infusion for a minimum of 21 days to a maximum of 28 days for infants without end-organ dissemination or for a maximum of 42 days for infants with end-organ dissemination.

Eradication was defined as culture or histologically documented absence of the infecting Candida species from all positive normally sterile sites during therapy, documented by 2 negative samples, drawn at least 24 hours apart, or for Candida meningitis and/or candiduria, 1 negative culture.

outcome.title: Time to Mycological Clearance of Invasive Candidiasis
outcome.description: Time to mycological clearance of invasive candidiasis is defined as the time from first dose to the day of mycological eradication for baseline invasive candidiasis infection. Eradication was defined as a culture or histologically documented absence of the infecting Candida species from all positive normally sterile sites during therapy, documented by 2 negative samples, drawn at least 24 hours apart, or for for Candida meningitis and/or candiduria, 1 negative culture. Infants without eradication during the treatment period and who survived were censored at one day after the end of treatment. Infants without eradication who died before completing the treatment period or were lost to follow-up during the treatment were censored at their death or last contact day.

outcome.description: Time to a positive clinical response is defined as the time from the first dose to the day during the treatment period that a positive clinical response (defined as a complete response or partial response) is observed for the first time, assessed by the Investigator. Complete Response is defined as the resolution of all attributable signs related to fungal infection, if present at baseline and Partial Response is defined as improvement in attributable signs related to the fungal infection, if present at baseline. Infants without positive responses and who survived were censored at one day post the end of treatment. Infants without positive responses who died before completing the treatment period, or were lost to follow-up during the treatment were censored at their death or last contact day.

group.description: Infants received micafungin at a dose of 10 mg/kg per day by intravenous infusion for a minimum of 21 days to a maximum of 28 days for infants without end-organ dissemination or for a maximum of 42 days for infants with end-organ dissemination.

group.title: Amphotericin B
group.description: Infants received amphotericin B deoxycholate (CAB) at a dose of 1.0 mg/kg per day by intravenous infusion for a minimum of 21 days to a maximum of 28 days for infants without end-organ dissemination or for a maximum of 42 days for infants with end-organ dissemination.

measure.title: Mycological Response One Week After Last Dose of Study Drug
measure.description: Mycological response assessments were based on the following definitions and assessed by the DRP: Eradication: Culture or histologically documented absence of the infecting Candida species from all positive normally sterile sites during therapy, documented by 2 negative samples, drawn at least 24 h apart; for Candida meningitis and/or candiduria, 1 negative culture. Persistence: Continued isolation or histological documentation from a normally sterile site.

outcome.title: Follow-up Status for Infants With End-organ Assessments
outcome.description: End-organ dissemination was assessed through abdominal ultrasound and/or computed tomography (CT), echocardiogram, head imaging and retinal exam. Each specific finding, documented by 1 of these techniques, was evaluated as follows: Improvement: Improvement in size, number or density of identified lesions. Complete response was not expected but may have been documented. Stabilization: Minor improvement or no change in size, number or density of identified lesions. Worsening: Increase in size or number of identified lesions.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 30 days after the last dose of study drug (maximum of 72 days)
outcome.population: Full analysis set participants with end-organ assessments

group.title: Micafungin
group.description: Infants received micafungin at a dose of 10 mg/kg per day by intravenous infusion for a minimum of 21 days to a maximum of 28 days for infants without end-organ dissemination or for a maximum of 42 days for infants with end-organ dissemination.

group.title: Amphotericin B
group.description: Infants received amphotericin B deoxycholate (CAB) at a dose of 1.0 mg/kg per day by intravenous infusion for a minimum of 21 days to a maximum of 28 days for infants without end-organ dissemination or for a maximum of 42 days for infants with end-organ dissemination.

measure.title: Follow-up Status for Infants With End-organ Assessments
measure.description: End-organ dissemination was assessed through abdominal ultrasound and/or computed tomography (CT), echocardiogram, head imaging and retinal exam. Each specific finding, documented by 1 of these techniques, was evaluated as follows: Improvement: Improvement in size, number or density of identified lesions. Complete response was not expected but may have been documented. Stabilization: Minor improvement or no change in size, number or density of identified lesions. Worsening: Increase in size or number of identified lesions.
measure.population: Full analysis set participants with end-organ assessments

outcome.title: Plasma Micafungin Concentration
outcome.time_frame: 15 minutes post intravenous infusion (IV), 4-8 hours post IV and 15-24 hours post IV
outcome.population: The pharmacokinetics (PK) analysis set, including those infants who received any amount of study drug, have at least one study drug concentration, and have dosing and blood collection date and time data sufficient for inclusion in a population pharmacokinetic analysis.

group.title: Micafungin
group.description: Infants received micafungin at a dose of 10 mg/kg per day by intravenous infusion for a minimum of 21 days to a maximum of 28 days for infants without end-organ dissemination or for a maximum of 42 days for infants with end-organ dissemination.

measure.title: Plasma Micafungin Concentration
measure.population: The pharmacokinetics (PK) analysis set, including those infants who received any amount of study drug, have at least one study drug concentration, and have dosing and blood collection date and time data sufficient for inclusion in a population pharmacokinetic analysis.

reported_events.time_frame: From first dose of study drug until 72 hours after the last dose; mean duration of study drug exposure among micafungin-treated patients was 18.6 days and 15.5 days for Amphotericin B-treated patients.

group.title: Micafungin
group.description: Infants received micafungin at a dose of 10 mg/kg per day by intravenous infusion for a minimum of 21 days to a maximum of 28 days for infants without end-organ dissemination or for a maximum of 42 days for infants with end-organ dissemination.

group.title: Amphotericin B
group.description: Infants received amphotericin B deoxycholate (CAB) at a dose of 1.0 mg/kg per day by intravenous infusion for a minimum of 21 days to a maximum of 28 days for infants without end-organ dissemination or for a maximum of 42 days for infants with end-organ dissemination.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Institute and/or Principal Investigator may publish trial data generated at their specific study site after Sponsor publication of the multi-center data or 18 months after data-lock, whichever is first. Sponsor must receive a site’s manuscript at least 30 days prior to publication for review and comment. Sponsor may delay the publication for up to 60 days to seek patent protection.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Medical Director, Global Medical Science
